results.title: Heather's case
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Improving Performance”.
The youngest clerical worker in a project team is angry about staff who are inconsiderate, messy and who avoid her whilst her colleagues have complained to the new supervisor about her being aggressive. The supervisor attempts to resolve the problem and then Peter Quarry assumes the role of supervisor and uses the 3 step approach.

results.title: L'age d'or des Provinces Unies = The golden age of the United Provinces
results.brief_description:
Episode 17 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
The Republic Of The United Netherlands, consisted of the seven northern Netherlands provinces that won independence from Spain from 1568 to 1609, and it grew out of the Union of Utrecht (1579). For the next two centuries political control of the decentralized state shifted repeatedly between the province of Holland and the princes of Orange, who held the office of stadholder and represented a greater degree of centralization. This internal political stress, however, did not prevent the ascendancy of the Dutch Republic in the 17th century. In this ‘Golden Age’ the Republic developed a worldwide colonial empire far out of proportion to its resources. It also played a notable role in the coalition wars against Louis XIV of France. As the Republic emerged as a centre of international finance, it alsom served as a notable cultural centre. This episode also covers the establishment of the East India Company in 1594, the settlement of the Puritans in New Amsterdam (New York) and the Black Tulip scandal. Reference: Encyclopedia Britannica.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: L'angleterre D'elizabeth = Elizabethan England
results.brief_description:
Episode 16 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
Elizabeth I becomes Queen at 25. Her 39 articles lay the foundation for the Anglican church. Declared a heretic by the Pope, she also has to battle with Spain for naval supremacy. Other topics include: the beginning of circumnavigation, the voyages of Sr Francis Drake and the settlement of North America.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: La Revolution Francaise = the French Revolution
results.brief_description:
Episode 22 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
A fourty minute overview of the events spanning from the storming of La Bastille to the irresistible ascent of Bonaparte. Reference: Encyclopedia Britannica.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Pax Romana
results.brief_description:
Episode 7 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
In 52 BC, Julius Cesar defeats Vercingetorix and conquers Gaul. Soon the Pax Romana will expand to all of Europe and the British Isles. This episode presents an overview of Roman civilisation with a particular focus on civil and military engineering.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Le Siecle D'or Espagnol
results.brief_description:
Episode 15 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
Though the traditional beginning of the Reconquista goes back to 718, when the Christian Asturians opposed the Moors at the Battle of Covadonga, the impulse toward reconquest was not strong during the first three centuries of Muslim hegemony. It was in the 11th century, when Moorish unity broke down and the Christian kingdoms of northern Spain began to be affected by an aggressive, anti-Muslim, crusading spirit, that the movement began in earnest. A series of wars followed, and by the mid-13th century most of the peninsula had been subjected to Christian rule, though the continued existence of a Moorish enclave around Granada in southern Spain served to keep the spirit of the Reconquista alive until the end of the 15th century. Many historians believe that subsequent Spanish emphasis on religious uniformity, evidenced by the strong influence of the Inquisition and the expulsion of people of Moorish and Jewish descent, can be traced back to this crusading struggle of the Middle Ages. Reference: Encyclopedia Britannica. Other topics include: The beginning of the slave trade, the Conquistadores and prominent artists of the period, such as El Greco and Cervantes.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: L'homme de Neandertal
results.brief_description:
Episode 2 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).This episode takes us among a tribe of hunters and gatherers to find out more about their tool making techniques. We also discover how their society is affected by the Ice Age.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].
